column3: Denotes source of data i.e. where the data is sourced from
column8: Source is direct point of data collection; 'origin' would indicate the original/others points of where the data originates from

column3: Denotes origin of data i.e. where the data originates from
column8: Source is direct point of data collection; 'origin' would indicate the original/others points of where the data originates from

column3: A generic property to describe how a technical or organisational measure is implemented.
Specifies existence or restriction regarding storage of data.
column8: This can be used to represent how data is being stored.

column3: Specifies existence or restriction regarding location.
column8: This can be used to represent where the data is being stored or processed or the location of an entity. There are no restrictions on granularity e.g. on-device, city, country, jurisdiction.

column3: Specifies existence or restriction regarding temporal duration.
column8: This can be used to associate a temporal duration, such as with personal data storage or processing. The temporal duration can be indicated as a period (e.g. 90 days) or as a fixed date (e.g. 2099-12-31).

column3: Restricts a purpose to the specified context(s)
Indicates the purpose is associated with activities in the indicated (Economic) Sector(s)
Cui bono? Who is the ultimate beneficiary of this purpose, here a stakeholder can be declared, e.g. the DataSubjects themselves or the Data Controller. ( --- under consideration --- )
column8: If we want ot be able to say something about the beneficiary of a purpose, we probably also need to say something about how the beneficiary benefits? - whether it is good for the controller or data subject
